meanings.definition: Spread out over a large area in an untidy or irregular way.
meanings.sent1: The sprawling cityscape was filled with buildings of all shapes and sizes.
meanings.sent2: The suburbs were known for their sprawling neighborhoods with houses spaced far apart.
meanings.sent3: The sprawling mess of toys on the floor made it impossible to walk without stepping on something.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like a sprawling garden, with ideas growing in every direction.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a sprawling mural that covered an entire wall.

meanings.definition: To sit or lie with the body and limbs spread out awkwardly.
meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, he sprawled on the couch, exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The cat sprawled lazily in the sun, enjoying the warmth.
meanings.sent3: She pretended to sprawl dramatically on the floor after hearing the surprising news.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree sprawled out like the arms of a giant octopus.
meanings.sent5: The injured player had to sprawl on the ground until the medic arrived.
